use_case_name: Manage User Accounts and System Settings
context_of_use: This use case allows an admin to manage user accounts and configure system settings within the system.
stakeholders_and_interests: admin: control system access and manage user accounts
user: customize system settings for optimal performance
power user: improve operational efficiency through bulk operations
description: This use case enables an admin to manage user accounts and configure system settings effectively.
triggering_event: An admin initiates the administration process.
preconditions: The admin must be logged into the system with appropriate privileges.
postconditions: User accounts are successfully managed, and system settings are configured without errors.
assumptions: The admin has the necessary permissions to perform administrative tasks.
The system is operational and accessible.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to manage user accounts.
The system shall permit users to configure system settings.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the specific permissions required for the admin.
main_flow: 1. admin → System allows admin to manage user accounts.
2. admin → System confirms user account management is successful.
3. admin → System permits admin to configure system settings.
4. admin → System confirms system settings are successfully configured.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 2): If the admin encounters an error while managing user accounts, the system prompts the admin to review the error and retry.
AF-2 (from Step 4): If the admin fails to configure system settings, the system provides guidance on required parameters.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If the admin is not logged in with appropriate privileges, the system denies access and prompts the admin to log in.
information_for_steps: 2. admin: confirmation of user account management
4. admin: confirmation of system settings configuration
